owl:Ontology.dc:title: Genomic Feature and Variation Ontology (GFVO)
owl:Ontology.dc:creator: Joachim Baran
owl:Ontology.dc:description: The Genomic Feature and Variation Ontology (GFVO) is modeled to represent genomic data using the Resource Description Format (RDF). It was modeled to capture at least the contents of data files that adhere to the Generic Feature Format Version 3 (GFF3) by Lincoln Stein (http://www.sequenceontology.org/resources/gff3.html), the General Transfer Format (GTF) by various contributors (http://mblab.wustl.edu/GTF22.html), the Genome Variation Format Version 1 (GVF) by Karen Eilbeck, Paul Flicek, Gabor Marth, Martin Reese, Lincoln Stein and Mark Yandell (http://www.sequenceontology.org/resources/gvf.html), and the Variant Call Format (VCF) by Petr Danecek, Adam Auton, Goncalo Abecasis, Cornelis A. Albers, Eric Banks, Mark A. DePristo, Robert E. Handsaker, Gerton Lunter, Gabor T. Marth, Stephen T. Sherry, Gilean McVean, Richard Durbin and the 1000 Genomes Project Analysis Group (http://vcftools.sourceforge.net/specs.html). The creation of the ontology was inspired by previous work of Robert Hoehndorf on RDF2OWL (http://code.google.com/p/rdf2owl).

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: alignment
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: An alignment is a sequence alignment between a "Feature" class instance and a "Target" class instance. The alignment is a list of one or more "Alignment Operation" instances that capture alignment matches, gaps and frameshifts (see "The Gap Attribute", http://sequenceontology.org/resources/gff3.html).

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: attribute method
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Further information about the "Method" that is related to an attribute.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: attributes
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Tag name/value pair attributes of a feature.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: breakpoint
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Potential source or destination of zero-length sequence alterations.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: breakpoint object property
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A properties that is directly associated with "Breakpoint" class instances.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: chromosome
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes abstract chromosome representations for capturing variants that appear on the same chromosome of a polyploid organism.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: contains
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship that describes which features belong to a feature set.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: data source
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Data source origin of the feature.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: dbxref
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A database cross-reference to associate a feature or its structured pragma metadata in GVF to a representation in another database.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: effect
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: An effect of a particular feature variant.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: effect object property
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Properties that are directly associated with "Effect" class instances.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: feature annotation object property
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property of one of the genomic annotation classes, such as "Breakpoint", "Reference", "Variant". For properties related to the core genomic data class "Feature", see "feature datatype property" or "feature object property".

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: feature object property
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Properties that are directly associated with "Feature" class instances. For properties related to "Reference", "Variant", or other genomic annotation classes, see "feature annotation datatype property" or "feature annotation object property".

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: feature ontology
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Explicit link-out to one or more ontologies that have been used for describing features. This is a meta comment about the URIs that link out to SO/SOFA or other ontologies.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: feature type
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A term that is describing the sequence feature that is being affected.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: genomic source
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes the source of genomic data (on a cell-type level). Valid object assignments are individuals of the "Genomic Source" enumeration class.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: genotype
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Determines the genotype as observed in an individual.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: individual
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links to information about an individual.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: locus
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The locus determines the genomic position of an genomic object. The FALDO "Region" class can denote genomic feature's start, stop, and strand properties, it can express fuzzy genomic ranges if exact genomic coordinates are unknown. For "Landmark" class instances, the locus provides the start and end coordinates of the landmark.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: locus annotation object property
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A property related to genomic coordinates. This can be a "locus" description that uses FALDO to denote Regions (with exact or probabilistic/fuzzy boundaries; "Breakpoint" locations) or an "operation" of a list of "Alignment Operation" instances that encode a CIGAR line.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: ontology term
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A cross-reference to an ontology term that is associated with a feature. For instances of the "Variant" class, the associated ontology term must be a Variant Ontology term (VariO; http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/VariO_0001 or subclasses thereof).

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: parent
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Link out to a parent feature.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: phenotype description
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Further information about an individual's phenotype. Applies only to single individual sets.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: phenotype description object property
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: An object property directly associated with "Phenotype Description" class instances.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: record object property
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A record object property is directly related to describing genomic feature or variant data. Classes that make use of record object properties are "Feature", "Variant", and so on. For container classes, such as "Set" and "File", see "set object property".

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: reference
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Specific information about the reference sequence of a feature.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: score method
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Used scoring method, which is described in more detail by a "Method" class instance.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: seqid
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Establishes the landmark on which the feature or breakpoint is located. A landmark is typically a chromosome, scaffold or contig, but can be any other genomic object (DNA, RNA, protein) in principle.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: sequence variant
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Effect of a sequence alteration on a sequence feature.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: sequenced individual object property
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A property that is directly associated with "Sequenced Individual" class instances.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: set annotation object property
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A property related to the annotation of "Set" class instances or its sub-classes, s.a. "Phenotype Description".

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: set object property
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A property that is directly associated with the "Set" class. Immediate sub-properties of this property are independent to specific specifications such as GFF3, GTF, GVF or VCF. Not all sub-properties can be preserved when carrying out operations between multiple "Set" class instances. For example, the "sex" property applies to single individual sets and can only be kept in a set union between multiple "Set" class instances if all involved instances agree on this property. For genomic feature and variant related properties, see "record object property" and "record datatype property".

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: source method
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Further information about the algorithm/methodologies used.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: species
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: NCBI Taxonomy Ontology "NCBITaxon_1" (or sub-classes) instance that denotes the species for a feature set.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: structured attributes
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Tag name/value pair attributes that are not captured by the GVF specification.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: target
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Identifies the target that the features aligns to.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: target attribute method
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Further information about the associated attribute(s).

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: target property
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A properties that is directly associated with "Target" class instances.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: technological annotation object property
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: An object property associated with annotations that are related to technological aspects regarding a genomic feature or variant. For example, a property of a "Technology Platform" or "Data Source".

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: technology platform
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Technology platform that was used to derive the feature.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: type
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Type of the feature, which is a child entry of sequence_feature (SO:0000110) of the full Sequence Ontology (SO).

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: variant
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Specific information about the variant(s) of a feature.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: variant object property
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Properties that are directly associated with "Variant" class instances.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: variation annotation object property
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A variation annotation object property is describing an object property of a "Variant" or "Effect" class instance.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: 3' context
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Sequence context of a feature on the positive strand (forward strand) on the 3' end. A valid sequence context is denoted by a string of one or more concatenated letters A, C, G, or T.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: 5' context
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Sequence context of a feature on the positive strand (forward strand) on the 5' end. A valid sequence context is denoted by a string of one or more concatenated letters A, C, G, or T.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: alias
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Secondary name of a feature besides the primary feature ID. The secondary name can be a HGVS/ISCN nomenclature name, but not a cross-reference to a database (e.g. dbSNP, OMIM). Cross-references should be made using the "dbxref" property.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: alignment operation datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that is directly associated with "Alignment Operation" instances.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: amino acid
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Amino acid in the reference genome that overlaps with a variant's genome coordinates.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: average coverage
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Undocumented in GVF specification. Even though the property's semantics are undocumented, it is still included in the ontology in order to reflect the data values that might be encoded in GVF files.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: build
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Name of a genome assembly build that denotes the provenance of genomic features and variants in a "Set". For example, 'GRCh37', 'NCBI 36', 'FlyBase r4.1', or 'hg19'. If possible, the patch level of the assembly build should be included, such as 'GRCh37.p7'.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: codon
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Describes the codon from the reference sequence whose coordinates overlap with this variant. A valid codon description is a string of three -- or multiples thereof -- concatenated letters A, C, G, or T.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: comment
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Comments should be made using "http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#comment".This datatype property only exists to redirect the focus to RDF Schema for commenting, since it might be expected that comments are modeled similar to other datatype properties involving "Data Source", "Method", "Phenotype Description" or "Technology Platform".

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: custom annotation datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Datatype property of an "Attribute" or "Structured Attribute" class instance. "Attribute" and "Structured Attribute" class instances are used to capture genomic feature and variation data assignments that may appear in a GFF3, GTF, GVF or VCF file, but which are not covered by their respective specifications.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: effect datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A datatype property that are directly associated with "Effect" class instances.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: feature
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Features that are affected by this sequence alteration effect. This can be an external feature identifier, such as an Ensembl gene/transcript identifier.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: feature annotation datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property of one of the genomic annotation classes, such as "Breakpoint", "Reference", "Variant". For properties related to the core genomic data class "Feature", see "feature datatype property" or "feature object property".

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: feature datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that is directly associated with a "Feature" class instance. For properties related to "Reference", "Variant", or other genomic annotation classes, see "feature annotation datatype property" or "feature annotation object property".

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: file datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Datatype properties related to "File" class instances. Subclasses of this property are used for denoting data that is specific to files only and which is only preserved as a means to encode for all data items defined by the GFF3, GTF, GVF and VCF specifications. These properties cannot be carried over into the result of set operations (s.a. union) between "File"/"Set" class instances. Keeping these properties in the result set between set operations may result in wrong annotations or contradictions (e.g., mutliple assignment of different versions or dates).

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: file date
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Creation date of the data file whose genomic data is captured by the associated "File" instance.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: file version
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Proprietary version of the file or its contents whose genomic data is associated with a "File" instance.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: frequency
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Frequency of a variant in a population. The population is determined by the "Set" in which the "Variant" resides.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: gff version
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Version of the GFF3 specification that defines the contents captured by the "File" class instance. The version number should be greater or equal than 3.0, but less than 4.0. For GFF2/GTF version number assignment, see the "gtf version" datatype property.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: gtf version
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Version of the GTF specification that defines the contents captured by the "File" class instance. The version number should be greater or equal than 2.0, but less than 3.0. This number derives from the fact that GTF files are equivalent to GFF2 files. GTF/GFF2 files are incompatible with the GFF3 specification. For GFF3 version number assignment, see the "gff version" datatype property.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: gvf version
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Version of the GVF specification that defines the contents captured by the "File" class instance. The version number should be greater or equal than 1.0, but less than 2.0. GVF files usually make a statement about their underlying GFF3 specification that they rely on too, which should be encoded using the "gff version" datatype property.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: id
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A unique identifier for the feature within the feature set (a "Set"/"File" class instance). The unique identifier is important when dealing with GFF3, GTF, GVF or VCF files as a stand in object that makes the aggregation and separation of genomic feature and variant information possible. In RDF, the URI of subject should be used primarily, provided that its URI can be considered stable.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: is circular
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Truth value describing whether the feature is circular or not. This can be used to describe, for example, circular DNA as being found in bacteria or viruses. It can also be applied to mitochondrial DNA or plastid DNA, where applicable.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: is phased
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates whether this particular feature is phased. Used to encode "##phased-genotypes" statements in GFF3, but can be appropriated freely. It is also a property of GVF variants, even though the GVF specification is unclear on its exact usage details.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: landmark datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that is directly associated with "Landmark" class instances.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: locus annotation datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A property related to, or associated with, genomic coordinates. This can be a genomic "sequence" description, the "frequency" of a "Variant", "phred score" of either "Variant" or "Reference", etc.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: name
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Name of a feature, which can be used for display purposes. The name is not a unique property among features in a "Set".

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: note
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Free text notes should be made using "http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#comment".This datatype property only exists to redirect the focus to RDF Schema for annotating features with notes, since it might be expected that a note is similarly modeled to other datatype properties of the "Feature" class.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: phase
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Phase of the feature, if it is a CDS. Called "frame" in GTF. A feature's phase can be either 0, 1, or 2.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: phred score
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A phred-scaled quality score for the reference seuence; -10log_10 prob(no variant). A phred-scaled quality score for a variant sequence; -10log_10 prob(variant call is wrong). High scores indicate high confidence calls. This is a property associated with VCF data. E-values and P-values of features should be expressed using the "score" datatype property.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: platform class
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Type of technology used to gather the variant data. The GVF specification's list of available classes is naturally incomplete. The range of this property is therefore unrestricted due to its open specification.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: platform name
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Sequencer or other machine used to collect the variant data. The GVF specification's list of available platforms is naturally incomplete. The range of this property is therefore unrestricted due to its open specification.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: read pair span
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Undocumented in GVF specification. Even though the property's semantics are undocumented, it is still included in the ontology in order to reflect the data values that might be encoded in GVF files.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: read length
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Undocumented in GVF specification. Even though the property's semantics are undocumented, it is still included in the ontology in order to reflect the data values that might be encoded in GVF files.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: reads
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Number of reads that are supporting a variant. Valid values are integers greater or equal than zero.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: record datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A record datatype property is directly related to describing genomic feature or variant data. Classes that make use of record datatype properties are "Feature", "Variant", and so on. For container classes, such as "Set" and "File", see "set datatype property".

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: reference annotation datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that is related to a "Reference" class instance. This property can also be applied to "Variant" class instances, which share the same datatype description, but differ in their semantic interpretation of a genomic feature.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: score
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Score of the feature. For example, an E-value for sequence similarity features or a P-value for ab initio gene prediction features. Phred scores that are associated with reference- or variant-sequences should be encoded using the "phred score" datatype property.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: sequence
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: All sequence variations at a locus -- including the reference sequence when appropriate (for example, when the locus is heterozygous). If the feature is on the minus strand, then the sequence is the reverse-compliment of the reference genome for these coordinates.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: sequenced individual datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that is directly associated with "Sequenced Individual" class instances.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: set datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A property that is directly associated with the "Set" class. Immediate sub-properties of this property are independent to specific specifications such as GFF3, GTF, GVF or VCF. Not all sub-properties can be preserved when carrying out operations between multiple "Set" class instances. For example, the "build" property can only be kept in a set union between multiple "Set" class instances if all involved instances agree on this property. For genomic feature and variant related properties, see "record object property" and "record datatype property".

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: source
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A free text qualifier that describes the algorithm or operating procedure that generated this feature. For example, the name of the software that generated this feature or a database name.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: span
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A span denotes the number of continuous nucleotides or amino acids an "Alignment Operation" is annotating. A span can be of length zero or greater.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: tag
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Tag name of a feature attribute. "Attribute" and "Structured Attribute" instances are key/value(s) pairs, The key in that assignment is referred to as the "tag". Custom annotations, i.e. attributes that are not defined by the file format specifications, should use lowercase tags. Future extensions of the specifications might introduce new attributes though, which can be encoded using custom annotations by RDFization tools. The tag should therefore not be treated as strictly lowercase when dealing with custom annotations.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: target datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that is directly associated with "Target" class instances.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: technological annotation datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A datatype property associated with annotations that are related to technological aspects regarding a genomic feature or variant. For example, a property of a "Technology Platform" class instance.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: technology platform datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that is directly associated with "Technology Platform" class instances.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: total reads
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Total number of reads for a "Sequenced Individual". When merging "Set"/"File" class instances, it should be noted whether the total number of reads needs to be updated based on the identity of sequenced individuals in the involved sets.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: variant datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A datatype property that is directly associated with "Variant" class instances.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: variation annotation datatype property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A variation annotation datatype property is describing a datatype property of a "Variant" or "Effect" class instance.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: vcf version
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Version of the VCF specification that defines the contents captured by the "File" class instance. The version number should be greater or equal than 4.0, but less than 5.0.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Alignment Operation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An alignment operation captures the type of alignment (see "Alignment" enumeration class) and alignment length between a reference sequence and target sequence. This relationship is typically expressed between a "Feature" class instance and a "Target" class instance. Note that an "Alignment Operation" is a list, where the order of the alignment operations is of significance.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Array Comparative Genomic Hybridization
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A "Data Source" based on array-comparative genomic hybridization.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Attribute
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An attribute represents a tag/value pair that is not covered by either GFF3, GTF, GVF or VCF specification. For example, lowercase tags in GFF3 are permitted to allow data providers to provide additional information about a genomic feature, variant, or its meta-data. Tag/value pair attributes that are within the aforementioned specifications are expressed using classes such as "Variant", "Breakpoint" or "Technology Platform".

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Breakpoint
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A breakpoint describes the source or destination of a zero-length sequence alteration. These alterations are typically insertions, deletions or translocations according to the GVF specification (see "Breakpoint_detail" in http://sequenceontology.org/resources/gvf.html).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Chromosome
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A chromosome is an abstract representation of an unnamed chromosome to represent ploidy within a data set. A "Chromosome" is typically used in conjunction with "Sequenced Individual" instances. For placing genomic features ("Feature" class instances) on a chromosome, contig, scaffold, etc., please see the "Landmark" class.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Custom Annotation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A custom annotation is any additionally provided genomic annotation that is not covered by the GFF3, GTF, GVF or VCF specifications, and hence, not represented by any other class in the ontology. For example, in GFF3, this would typically cover the attributes with lowercase tags of column 9, which are permitted by the standard as user defined annotations.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DNA Microarray
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A "Data Source" based on DNA microarray probes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DNA Sequence
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A "Data Source" based on DNA sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Source
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Provides information about the source of the data. For example, it can link out to actual sequences associated with "Feature" individuals in a "Set".

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Effect
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Describing the effect of a feature variant.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Feature
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The feature class captures information about genomic sequence features. A genomic feature can be a large object, such as a chromosome or contig, down to single base-pair reference or variant alleles. A feature class instance is a composite of further information that is encoded using "Attribute", "Reference", "Variation" and other sub-classes of "Feature Annotation".

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Feature Annotation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A feature annotation is a class whose instances are used as composites in conjunction with "Feature" class instances. The "Feature Annotation" class is typically not used as type annotation. It rather denotes that its subclasses are to be used for extending genomic features with additional information.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: File
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A file represents the contents of a GFF3, GTF, GVF or VCF file. It can capture genomic meta-data that is specific to any of these file formats. The result of unions, intersections or other operations between "File" class instances should be capture with the generic "Set" class, which is format independent.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Forward Reference Sequence Frameshift
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denotes a frameshift forward in the reference sequence. The reference sequence is denoted by a "Landmark" whilst the aligned target sequence is an instance of the "Target" class.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Fragment Read Platform
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Details about the fragment-read sequencing technology used to gather the data in a set.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Germline Feature
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The germline feature class captures information about genomic sequence features arising from germline cells.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Hemizygous Variant
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A sequence alteration with hemizygous alleles.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Heterozygous Variant
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A sequence alteration with heterozygous alleles.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Homozygous Variant
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A sequence alteration with homozygous alleles.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Landmark
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A landmark establishes a coordinate system for features. Landmarks can be chromosomes, contigs, scaffolds or other constructs that can harbor "Feature" class instances. For expressing ploidy within a data set, please refer to the "Chromosome" class.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Locus Annotation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A locus annotation puts a genomic feature or variation in context or provides additional information about particular location related aspects that fall within a feature's range (expressed by the "locus" object property of the "Feature" class). The "Locus Annotation" class is not instantiated itself, but rather one of its subclasses. For example, "Landmark" is used to place a "Feature" on a chromosome, scaffold, contig, or other genomic entity.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Match
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denotes a match between the reference sequence and target sequence. The reference sequence is denoted by a "Landmark" whilst the aligned target sequence is an instance of the "Target" class.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Method
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Information about the used scoring algorithm or method.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Paired Read Platform
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Details about the paired-read sequencing technology used to gather the data in a set.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Phenotype Description
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A phenotype description represents additional information about a sequenced individual's phenotype.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Prenatal Feature
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A prenatal feature is purportedly associated with prenatal cells; the GVF specification declares this feature type under the prama directive "##genomic-source", but does not describe its semantics and the referenced Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC, http://loinc.org), do not define the meaning or intended usage of the term "prenatal" either.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNA Sequence
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A "Data Source" based on RNA sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Record
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A record is an abstract representation of a genomic feature, genomic variation, or its composite elements. A record is typically not instantiated in itself, but rather its child classes (s.a. "Feature", "Variation", "Reference", etc.) are types for OWL individuals.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Reference
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denotes the reference sequence of a feature. The reference sequence is of importance when dealing with genomic variation data, which is expressed by the "Variant" class.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Reference Sequence Gap
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denotes a gap in the reference sequence for an alignment. The reference sequence is denoted by a "Landmark" whilst the aligned target sequence is an instance of the "Target" class.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Reverse Reference Sequence Frameshift
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denotes a frameshift backwards (reverse) in the reference sequence. The reference sequence is denoted by a "Landmark" whilst the aligned target sequence is an instance of the "Target" class.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sequenced Female
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Aggregated sequencing information for a particular female individual. A female is defined as an individual producing ova.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sequenced Hermaphrodite
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Aggregated sequencing information for a particular individual that contains both male and female gemetes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sequenced Individual
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Aggregated sequencing information for a particular individual. Unless a sub-type of this class is used as instance type, s.a. "Sequenced Female", the sex of the individual is considered to be undetermined.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sequenced Male
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Aggregated sequencing information for a particular male individual. A male is defined as an individual producing spermatozoa.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Set
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A set is a container for genomic sequence features and related information that is independent of data provenance. A set may contain information about any genomic features including -- but not limited to -- contents of GFF3, GTF, GVF and VCF files. The latter are better represented by "File" class instances, whereas the result of unions or intersections between different "File" class instances should be captured within this format-independent "Set" class.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Set Annotation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A set annotation denotes that its subclasses can be used to extend a "Set" with additional information, s.a. a "Phenotype Description". Set annotations are file format independent and can be preserved when carrying out operations between "File"/"Set" instances. Depending on the annotation, it may or may not be able to carry it over in operations such as taking the union of two or more sets, since the scope of a "Set Annotation" applies to all "Feature" instances within the resulting "Set".

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Somatic Feature
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The somatic feature class captures information about genomic sequence features arising from somatic cells.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Structured Attribute
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A structured attribute denotes a tag/value pair where the value is a composite, but which is not defined in the GVF specification. The GVF specification does not explicitly permit user-defined structured attributes (see "Structured Pragmas" in http://sequenceontology.org/resources/gvf.html), but it is conceivable that an RDFization tool might support this use case. For some loosly defined structured data in GVF, the "Structured Attribute" class is used as well to capture the non-exhaustive list of possible data assignments of the GVF specification.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Target
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A target expresses the relationship between a "Feature" instance and an alignment. In GFF3, the alignment can be a nucleotide-to-nucleotide or protein-to-nucleotide (see "The Gap Attribute", http://sequenceontology.org/resources/gff3.html), but this restriction is not enforced here. Note that the object property "alignment" links out to a list of "Alignment Operation" class instances, where only the first operation in that list is referenced via the "alignment" property. The remainder of operations can be accessed by stepping through the list.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Target Sequence Gap
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Denotes a gap in the target sequence for an alignment. The reference sequence is denoted by a "Landmark" whilst the aligned target sequence is an instance of the "Target" class.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Technological Annotation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A technological annotation provides meta-data about the means that led to a genomic feature or variant discovery. This can be a provenance annotation, such as "Data Source", it can be describing a "Method", or it can be information about the "Technology Platform" used.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Technology Platform
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Details about the sequencing/microarray technology used to gather the data in a set.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Variant
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Describing specific sequence alterations of a genomic feature. A variant is related to "Reference" class instances, which denote the sequence that serves as a basis for sequence alteration comparisons.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Variation Annotation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A variant annotation captures information about a genomic "Variant". A possible effect of a variant is encoded using "Effect" class instances.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Array Comparative Genomic Hybridization
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes an array-comparative genomic hybridization.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: DNA Microarray
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes a DNA microarray probe.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: DNA Sequence
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes a DNA sequence.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: IFemale
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes that a "Set" contains genomic features or variants of a female. IFemales are defined as individuals producing ova.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Forward Reference Sequence Frameshift
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes a frameshift forward in the reference sequence. The reference sequence is denoted by a "Landmark" whilst the aligned target sequence is an instance of the "Target" class.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: IFragment
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes reads that are fragments.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: IGermline
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes that a "Set" contains features of germline cells.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: IHemizygous
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes hemizygous alleles.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: IHermaphrodite
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes that a "Set" contains features of an individual that contains both male and female gemetes.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: IHeterozygous
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes heterozygous alleles.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: IHomozygous
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes homozygous alleles.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: IMale
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes that a "Set" contains genomic features or variants of a male. IMales are defined as the individuals producing spermatozoa.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: IMatch
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes a match between the reference sequence and target sequence. The reference sequence is denoted by a "Landmark" whilst the aligned target sequence is an instance of the "Target" class.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: IPair
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes reads that are pairs.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: IPrenatal
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes that a set contains features of prenatal cells.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: RNA Sequence
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes an RNA sequence.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Reference Sequence Gap
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes a gap in the reference sequence for an alignment. The reference sequence is denoted by a "Landmark" whilst the aligned target sequence is an instance of the "Target" class.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Reverse Reference Sequence Frameshift
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes a frameshift backwards (reverse) in the reference sequence. The reference sequence is denoted by a "Landmark" whilst the aligned target sequence is an instance of the "Target" class.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: ISomatic
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes that a "Set" contains features of somatic cells.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Target Sequence Gap
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Denotes a gap in the target sequence for an alignment. The reference sequence is denoted by a "Landmark" whilst the aligned target sequence is an instance of the "Target" class.
